docs.title: FOSSInvoice
docs.text: FOSSInvoice is a free, open sourced, desktop application desgined to be used by any company that want a easy and lightway Invoice system. It's a fully local application, with no need to create accounts, external services or even Internet access.

docs.title: What It Does
docs.text: Create and manage invoices for multiple business identities ("companies") in one place, generate clean PDF documents with your branding, and keep everything stored in a portable database file you fully own.

docs.title: Core Product Principles
docs.text: Principle What it Means Focused Scope Invoicing essentials first. Avoid bloat. Local‑First All data lives on your computer. No forced cloud. Multi‑Company Manage multiple companies. Switch easily between them. Portable Data A single database file you can copy, move, version, or back up.

docs.title: Key Features (Early Stage)
docs.text:
• Manage multiple companies (name, tax ID, address, contact details, logo)
  • Maintain a list of clients per company
  • Draft invoices with line items (quantity, unit price, automatic totals)
  • Single tax rate + optional absolute discount per invoice (more flexible tax/discount logic coming)
  • Localized PDF export with logo, structured layout, totals
  • JSON-based UI translations (multi-language)
  • Per‑invoice optional footer text
  • Invoice status, switch easily as the process evolves
  • Lightweight application, works on (almost) any specs

docs.title: What You Can Use It For
docs.text: Scenario How FOSSInvoice Helps Freelancer with multiple brands Keep each brand as a separate company; only one app Privacy‑sensitive work Avoid uploading client billing data to third parties Offline environments Generate invoices without an internet connection Portable workflows Carry DB + binary on encrypted USB / synced folder Simple archiving Easy backup and restore with only copying a file

docs.title: Portable Database Concept
docs.text:
All operational data sits in one database file:

companies, clients, invoices, invoice_items

Backups are trivial:

  1. Exit the app
  2. Copy the DB file to a backup location (cloud drive, git-crypt repo, USB, etc.)
  3. Restore by replacing the file

docs.title: Data Ownership & Transparency
docs.text: No hidden sync, telemetry, or remote API calls. Your data never leaves your computer unless you explicitly move or share it.

docs.title: Who It’s For
docs.text: User Type Fit Solo freelancer Strong (multi‑brand + portability) Entrepreneurs Strong (easy + clean) Boutique agency Good for lightweight billing Data‑privacy advocate Ideal – local & inspectable Enterprise accounting Not a target (no heavy compliance stack)

docs.title: Differentiators vs SaaS Invoicing
docs.text: Area SaaS Tool FOSSInvoice Data Control Vendor DB Your local file Offline Use Limited Full Cost Subscription Free & Open source Customization Varies Source available Export Effort Often partial Copy one file

docs.title: Developer Guide
docs.text: Technical reference for contributors and advanced users.

docs.title: 1. Stack Overview
docs.text: Area Tech Platform Wails v3 (Go + WebView) Backend Go 1.22+, GORM (SQLite) Frontend React + TypeScript + Vite PDF go-pdf/fpdf

docs.title: 2. Repository Layout
docs.text:
internal/        Go models & services
frontend/        React app (Vite)
build/           Packaging assets & config
bin/             Output binaries/installers
docs/            Documentation site (MkDocs)

docs.title: 3. Models (GORM)
docs.text:
Relationships: 

Company 1---* Client 1---* Invoice 1---* InvoiceItem
Simplified embedded contact info in company & client.

docs.title: 4. Services
docs.text: File Responsibility services/database.go DB open/migrate (check actual implementation) services/pdf.go Invoice -> PDF rendering services/config.go Load configuration (language etc.)

docs.title: 5. PDF Generation Flow
docs.text:
ExportInvoicePDF(dbPath, invoiceID, outPath, lang)
  -> Open DB
  -> Query invoice + relations
  -> Render header/company/client
  -> Render items & totals
  -> Localized labels via i18n

docs.title: 6. Internationalization
docs.text: The app uses simple key-based JSON locale bundles for both the UI and PDF generation.

docs.title: Frontend (UI Strings)
docs.text:
Loaded at runtime from frontend/public/locales/<code>.json via dynamic fetch in frontend/src/i18n/index.tsx.

Key lookup uses dot notation (e.g. common.save, messages.noClientsYet). Missing keys fall back to the path string itself so you can easily spot gaps.

Supported locale codes are declared in SUPPORTED_LOCALES inside the i18n provider. The selected code (2‑letters) is persisted through the backend ConfigService so that PDFs can reuse the same language.

docs.title: Backend (PDF Labels)
docs.text:
PDF label translations live in embedded JSON under internal/i18n/locales/<code>.json and are loaded at compile time using go:embed. They currently only need the pdf section (subset of labels used in the PDF layout).

Translator usage: 

tr := i18n.T(lang)
tr("pdf.invoice") // -> localized string or key fallback

docs.title: Adding a New Language
docs.text:
UI + PDF need coordinated additions.

  1. Frontend: copy frontend/public/locales/en.json → <code>.json and translate values.
  2. Backend: copy internal/i18n/locales/en.json → <code>.json and translate values.
  3. Update SUPPORTED_LOCALES and LOCALE_LABELS in frontend/src/i18n/index.tsx.
  4. Rebuild (wails3 dev or build tasks). The UI will fetch the new JSON; backend will have the embedded file.
  5. Switch language in the UI (persists to config) and generate a PDF to verify.

docs.title: Keeping Frontend & Backend Locales in Sync
docs.text: Because we embed backend JSON at compile time and serve frontend JSON at runtime, duplication exists.

docs.title: Fallback Strategy
docs.text:
1. Frontend: missing key → key path text.
  2. Backend: missing in chosen lang → English → key.

Keep keys stable; renames should update both JSON sets. Avoid embedding variable data inside values—string interpolation is not yet implemented.

docs.title: 7. Database
docs.text:
• SQLite single file
  • Automatic schema creation via GORM AutoMigrate (assumed confirm in code)
  • Migration versioning not yet implemented

docs.title: 8. Frontend Architecture
docs.text:
• React functional components
  • Context providers for selected company, database path, toasts
  • Minimal styling

docs.title: 9. Dev Workflow
docs.text:
Install wails3 cli:

go install github.com/wailsapp/wails/v3/cmd/wails3@latest

Dev run with hot realoads:

wails3 dev

Build debug binary: 

wails3 task build

Build production binary: 

wails3 task build PRODUCTION=true

Create installed and packaged versions: 

wails3 task package

docs.title: 10. Contributing
docs.text: There's not official docs for this. Contributions are very welcomed and really appreaciated. Just open an Issue or directly a PR for small changes.

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text: Frequently asked (or anticipated) questions.

docs.title: Is my data sent anywhere?
docs.text: No. All data stays local in a SQLite database.

docs.title: Where is the database stored?
docs.text: You can create and store the database file anywhere you want.

docs.title: Can I change the invoice numbering scheme?
docs.text: Invoices follow a default sequentially increasing numbering, but you can define any number you want.

docs.title: Does it support multiple currencies?
docs.text: Yes. Common currencies are supported, both per-company and per-invoice. (Invoice currency is printed in the render PDF).

docs.title: How do I back up my data?
docs.text: Manual: copy the database file.

docs.title: Can I run it from a USB drive?
docs.text: Yes, both the application and the database file can be used form an external USB drive.

docs.title: Is there a dark mode?
docs.text: Currently there's only one theme.

docs.title: Does it auto-update?
docs.text: Not initially. Manual downloads until update system is implemented.

docs.title: How can I contribute a translation?
docs.text: See developer guide.

docs.title: More Questions?
docs.text: Open an issue in the repository.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This page explains how to install and run FOSSInvoice on supported platforms.

docs.title: Download (End Users)
docs.text:
1. Visit the Releases page: Releases
  2. Choose the installer or archive for your platform:
    • Windows: .exe installer or portable executable
    • macOS: .zip file
    • Linux: no binaries published yet, go to developer guide.
  3. Install / run.

docs.title: Updating
docs.text:
• Replace the binary / install newer release.
  • Database should be auto-migrated if needed, but check the specific release notes.

docs.title: Uninstalling
docs.text: • Delete the application bundle/binary.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Issue Possible Fix App fails to start on Windows Ensure WebView2 runtime installed (Edge based). Database locked Close running instance; avoid simultaneous access. Other? Check current issues or open a new one on GitHub.

docs.title: Companies
docs.text: Companies represent your own business entities (you can manage multiple) with their own Name, tax ID, Address and logo.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Field Description Name Legal or trade name Address Postal/billing address (multi-line) Tax ID VAT / EIN / NIF etc. Contact (embedded) Email / phone / website Logo Base64 image stored for PDF header

docs.title: Actions
docs.text:
• Create / Edit / Delete company
  • Upload / change logo
  • Set default values for invoices

docs.title: Logo Recommendations
docs.text: Aspect Recommendation Format PNG (transparent) or JPEG Size ~256x256 px (scaled in PDF) File size Keep small (<200 KB)

docs.title: Data Storage
docs.text: All company data lives in the local SQLite database.

docs.title: Clients
docs.text: Clients are buyers you issue invoices to.

docs.title: Fields
docs.text: Field Description Name Client or organization name Address Billing address Tax ID VAT / EIN etc. Contact (embedded) Optional email / phone / website

docs.title: User Guide: Databases
docs.text: A Database is a traditional file, with a .db extension. This file is used to store companies, clients and invoices information in a SQLite format. It can be opened and explored using standard SQLite tools.

docs.title: Backup
docs.text: It can be backed up as any other file on a computer: encrypted, copied to a external USB drive, uploaded to cloud storages, etc.

docs.title: Restore
docs.text: Databse files, as any file, can be restored by just getting the old version and replacing it.

docs.title: User Guide
docs.text: Follow this sequence the first time (and each time you switch workspaces):

docs.title: Condensed Flow
docs.text: DB file → Company list → Select/Create company → Add clients → Create invoice → Export PDF → Backup DB.

docs.title: Step 1: Select or Create a Database File
docs.text:
• On launch, the app prompts you to choose an existing database file or create a new one (on the first lunch create a new one).
  • Recommended: Store it somewhere you already back up (e.g. a synced or encrypted folder).
  • You can maintain multiple database files (e.g. one per groups of companies).

docs.title: Step 2: Create (or Pick) a Company
docs.text:
• If the database is new, there are no companies yet.
  • Create a company with its identity details (name, tax ID, address, contact, logo).
  • If companies already exist, you’ll see a list to choose from.

docs.title: Step 3: Open a Company context
docs.text:
• Selecting a company “enters” that company context.
  • All subsequent actions (clients, invoices) belong to the active company.
  • You can exit back to the company selection screen to switch.

docs.title: Step 4: Manage Company Data
docs.text:
• Adjust company profile (logo, address, tax ID) as needed.
  • Specify default values if needed (default Tax value, currency, footer, etc).
  • Changes immediately reflect in future invoices.

docs.title: Step 5: Add / Edit Clients
docs.text:
• Create client records (each company has its own client list).
  • Keep client data clean. Updates apply to all client invoices, and new PDFs will have the new info.

docs.title: Step 6: Create an Invoice
docs.text:
1. Create invoice
  2. Select client
  3. Add line items (description, quantity, unit price)
  4. Set tax rate (single global rate for now)
  5. Pick the invoice status (Draft, Pending, etc)
  6. (Optional) Add an absolute discount
  7. (Optional) Add footer
  8. (Optional) Add notes (not render in the PDF)
  9. Save / export PDF

docs.title: Step 7: Export / Distribute
docs.text:
• Generate PDF (saved locally).
  • Send manually (email / upload / print).

docs.title: User Guide: Invoices
docs.text: Invoices record billable transactions between a company and a client.

docs.title: Key Concepts
docs.text: Concept Notes Number Sequential integer, set by default to the next number Issue Date Invoice issue date (printed on PDF) Due Date Optional Fiscal Year Manually set; used for grouping/reporting Currency ISO 4217 code (UI limited set) Tax Rate Percentage applied to subtotal (not per item) Discount Absolute amount deducted before tax total Status Draft / Pending / Sent / Paid / Void (manually updated) Footer Text Printed at bottom of PDF

docs.title: Line Items
docs.text: Field Description Description What is being billed Quantity Supports fractional (e.g. hours) Unit Price Monetary amount (no currency symbol) Total Auto: Quantity * Unit Price

docs.title: Calculations
docs.text:
Subtotal = Σ(line totals)

TaxAmount = Subtotal * (TaxRate / 100)

Total = Subtotal + TaxAmount - DiscountAmount

docs.title: PDF Export
docs.text: Invoices can be exporter on PDF format thought the export button on the invoice list.
